title: Watch Alana Haim in First Clip from Kelly Reichardt’s The Mastermind
description: The youngest Haim sister is also set to appear in forthcoming films from Kristoffer Borgli and Paul Thomas Anderson
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The youngest Haim sister is also set to appear in forthcoming films from Kristoffer Borgli and Paul Thomas Anderson
text: The youngest Haim sister is also set to appear in forthcoming films from Kristoffer Borgli and Paul Thomas AndersonAlana Haim, Kelly Reichardt, and Josh O’Connor, May 2025 (Victor Boyko/Getty Images)Following its premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival, Kelly Reichardt’s forthcoming new film The Mastermind has received its first official preview. In the clip, which features co-stars Josh O’Connor and Alana Haim, O’Connor steals a toy soldier figurine from a museum display case as Haim stays with their children. Watch it below.In addition to The Mastermind, Alana Haim is set to appear in Kristoffer Borgli’s The Drama and Paul Thomas Anderson’s One Battle After Another. Next month, she’ll release the next Haim album, I Quit, alongside her sisters. The follow-up to 2020’s Women in Music Pt. III has been led by the singles “Relationships,” “Everybody’s Trying to Figure Me Out,” and “Down to Be Wrong.” A fourth track is poised to arrive later this week, according to the band’s Instagram. In September, Haim will kick off a tour of the U.K. and North America.Read Anna Gaca’s track review of Haim’s “Relationships,” and revisit our 2020 interview “What First Cow Director Kelly Reichardt Is Listening To.”Walden Green is a music writer and cultural critic who joined Pitchfork in 2024. A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, his work has appeared in Dirt, The Fader, and Philadelphia. He lives in New York. ... Read more
html:
The youngest Haim sister is also set to appear in forthcoming films from Kristoffer Borgli and Paul Thomas Anderson

Following its premiere at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival, Kelly Reichardt’s forthcoming new film The Mastermind has received its first official preview. In the clip, which features co-stars Josh O’Connor and Alana Haim, O’Connor steals a toy soldier figurine from a museum display case as Haim stays with their children. Watch it below.

In addition to The Mastermind, Alana Haim is set to appear in Kristoffer Borgli’s The Drama and Paul Thomas Anderson’s One Battle After Another. Next month, she’ll release the next Haim album, I Quit, alongside her sisters. The follow-up to 2020’s Women in Music Pt. III has been led by the singles “Relationships,” “Everybody’s Trying to Figure Me Out,” and “Down to Be Wrong.” A fourth track is poised to arrive later this week, according to the band’s Instagram. In September, Haim will kick off a tour of the U.K. and North America.

Read Anna Gaca’s track review of Haim’s “Relationships,” and revisit our 2020 interview “What First Cow Director Kelly Reichardt Is Listening To.”

Walden Green is a music writer and cultural critic who joined Pitchfork in 2024. A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, his work has appeared in Dirt, The Fader, and Philadelphia. He lives in New York. ... Read more
